metadata.title: CVE-2015-6031 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
Buffer overflow in the IGDstartelt function in igd_desc_parse.c in theMiniUPnP client (aka MiniUPnPc) before 1.9.20150917 allows remote UPNPservers to cause a denial of service (application crash) and possiblyexecute arbitrary code via an "oversized" XML element name.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-6031` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libminiupnpc8 - 1.6-3ubuntu2.14.04.2
miniupnpc - 1.6-3ubuntu2.14.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: miniupnpc package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.6-3ubuntu2.14.04.2').
